documents.document: @douglasfriedli It's got to be Dempseys, Full Moon, Clwb. You might not get Sisters of Mercy, but The Cure's a cert.
@tomreederwho I feel a bit ill after that
@tomreederwho Number three actually, although not a trilogy. That would probably have been more lucrative.
@ms_organised @FootballRamble That'd be lovely
@MPearlo When a pumped-up Neil Warnock awaits, Pearlo...
Right, Daniel, stop listening to @FootballRamble & give me 1000 words on this novel before three pre-game pints and a Ken Zohore wonder goal
Hooked thanks to @itsmikelike. It's the Kevin Bacon game for music- e.g. Kavana to Nas via Dane Bowers & Vivaldi 🎶 https://t.co/NcHTSg9epr
@MichaelBaker95 @retroshirtcity They must have sold the mediums before hand. Hopefully there'll be some more.
@rhodrielisjones @retroshirtcity I can't wear it like Shaun Ryder. They were all gone at 18.59. What the actual?
@retroshirtcity How the hell have all the mediums gone already?
Au revoir Citizen Kane, there's a new greatest film in town @JonnyOwenFilm #TogetherStronger ⚽😎🍻🗼🐲 https://t.co/zDBVXuJkBM
@LittleTimmkins @Thevegabodegas If this was ten years ago, you could have played in my kitchen but nowadays Yoko (my cat) would batter me
@_JoaoMorais @TheDaiLlew Just reminded me I needed to buy tickets for this, which I've now done. Taaa.
"The teams have lovely nicknames" @timhhartley on this and much more from AFCON in Gabon on @BBCRadio4 today https://t.co/b6yrwgbpZJ
@c_kirwan That sounds like a lost Pulp lyric
Hell is not quite being able to hear if the neighbours are arguing again because he's having an affair or has over-sugared a tea.
If anyone makes me a gig poster for this incendiary line-up, you can co-curate Meltdown with me when the inevitable call comes.
I'M POLONIUS- 6th form common roomers with epic sound; manager from Business Studies AS-level class; strategy to headline stadia by 2019
F5 REFRESH- the music to soundtrack Article 50 invocation. Long player 'Bombs Drop on Slough' gets favourable Amazon review from Ed Miliband
FRANNY & ZOOEY- encourage the audience to sit down during the encore of 'happenings', send a hand-drawn 1/4erly fanzine to early adopters
UNICORN SHOEHORN- desc by Zoella as 'like doing acid with Brian Blessed at a dystopian village fete', resulting in huge Facebook like surge
EMO GEE- what happens when shoe gaze and G-Funk eat too much vodka jelly and mate in a box room. Unlistenable.
Just spent a 45 minute spin class daydreaming fake bands when I really should have been working out novel scenes. Not done this for a bit...
When I get writer's block next I'll remember that Joseph Conrad wrote with icicle fingers on this bench in… https://t.co/9Wc1OrsOsJ
Seems a pretty poignant day to visit Schindler's Factory. https://t.co/F0DJimGEa5
Just a normal Sunday touring a Utopian workers' paradise in an East German Trabant car. https://t.co/REwsAOU7R8
@DafPritchard If you're still in Vegas, fellow Bluebird @dai_r1927 has got a hell of a rock show on there. You dudes would get along.
@TheDaiLlew Try Embrace of the Serpent after eight pints.
@TheDaiLlew One of the best cinema experiences in years. Front row of screen two at Chapter. Bam. Unrelenting in your face brilliance.
The biggest national disgrace that it took so long for that question to be answered truthfully #jft96
His tears woke me up in the night. He was in my bedroom, crying, asking my nan 'why? why?' #jft96
I was only 8 but I remember the day like it was yesterday. Me and my dad had watched Liverpool at Wembley months before. #jft96
In bits after @rondomedia's Hillsborough film @BBCiPlayer. Proud we've helped spread story @WorkingWordPR #jft96 https://t.co/ppPdV0rSS9
@drlaurajwaters @DrAScourfield We're nice boyos!
@streetfoodCDF Sophia Gardens. Make it happen. Peace and love, the hungry of Pontcanna 🍻 ❤🍕
@sijonze On it. I sense a WhatsApp group forming...
Press release writing 101 No #1: Be objective #2: Avoid hyperbole #3: Don't use crappy fonts #PR https://t.co/VKrrIjpOSs
@RhodriabOwen Good talk. Enjoyed that. Would be keen to hear for a follow-up on the Arlington tales!
Generation Y didn't you vote for Hillary, Millennials? Trump talk with @RhodriabOwen this morning, who knocked door… https://t.co/ZHEJpJixLr
@ACrispix @CardiffCityLive @WelshSportLive He's the handshake police. Warnock, I fancy, would favour a cupped supporting hand in friendship.
@utocue 'The fans are drinking their Bovrils, those of whom like to drink beef-extract drinks before the game starts.'
Potentially the best 'hmm, we've got some pre-match content to make but nothing is happening' tweet of the season… https://t.co/B8WndKK3RU
Tonight on @s4c at 9.30 there's a new Hillsborough doc from @rondomedia. Preview here from @Independent https://t.co/2EM545dCus
Spot on from @prodnose on @BBC6Breakfast on pop culture change- compare 1962-1972 vs 2007-2017, where main change is the shape of our phones
@dellamy @Sporf The greatest fire. Really great fire.
@gavinwallen Definitely up for a pizza-themed stats-based approach to our next season ticket
@SarahvKilcoyne @TheCraigAustin Imagine how different life could have been if I'd put you off...
@iammarcthomas And those piano fingers came in very handy on the chain gang.
@TheCraigAustin Actually, it was @SarahvKilcoyne's car #neverforget
@TheCraigAustin The only time I've been to Ynysybwl, my car was locked in a junk yard and I saw a child with a gun. True story.
And in other news, Rutger Hauer has morphed into Anthony Hopkins. https://t.co/zWPT5Nkgaz
To the courts, Gwen Evans got 3 months more hard labour than Richard Groom for 'obtaining food by false pretences'.… https://t.co/lZLL3PUZfF
Today I'm reading the morning's local papers so you don't have to. Say hi to Kooga, a hair metal band from Ynysybw… https://t.co/GGARftN7lt
@gourmetgorro It's @ClaudineLMartin. How I love recipe testing nights with her and @rhodmartin.
@ianjamesjohnson @LEJ88 What a trip! I was ball boy at the home leg, the scene of a 5-1 tanking and a Robbie James belter as consolation
@LEJ88 The scene of Tony Bird's double!
@ILovesTheDiff @WalesOnline Colin is totally jazz club 🎷
@kirstiemccrum @WalesOnline Only very open-minded ones
Wonderful social insight from Colin of Colin's Books, the sex shop on Chippy Lane in Cardiff @walesonline… https://t.co/u9LMHqN3pE
Jesus having 33 as his number is pretty dark #MCITOT
Watching the final @CNNOriginals Race for the White House, reminiscing on a time when Hillary did win… https://t.co/kNkNbBQgPY
@Adam_C_Smith @ScottySlungLow NQAT it was guerrilla marketing for the new X-Files series.
The years haven't been very kind to The Polyphonic Spree #Inauguration https://t.co/U67FwfBx1z
@cardiffbhoy Trump Around. Actual LOL at that.
Throwback to the time 8 years ago when we left work early to watch Obama’s inauguration and I spilt a pint over everyone in Wetherspoons.
A day for playing Rage Against The Machine LOUD.
@swansareflying Too busy on the iron, Steve (I hope...)
@drlaurajwaters @BritishHIVAssoc @ProfJAnderson @ZMEScience Used is as an eg in a talk I gave on gamification a few years back. Incredible!
@drlaurajwaters @BritishHIVAssoc @ProfJAnderson I'm sure you know about this Laura, but it blew my mind https://t.co/szCSD5YExj
Yeah Yeah Yeahs on loud, dancing, sweating, my eyes open, the butch Spin instructor grunts 'faster' and I cry for the death of the party.
@leannadavies1 My thoughts exactly!
@pennywisepeter You're right, it's the right way around. You'd never pick a kettlebell up while engaged with a pancake roll.
@Jonny_Ellis @iammarcthomas Go and talk to them. They crave interruption.
@carolyn_hitt On statues of women, have you seen the new Cilla one in Liverpool? Totally joyful @CerithMathias https://t.co/q8vwsvKpat
@cerysfurlong Have a blast birthday twin!
@FuntimeFranky Thanks mate! See you at Jeffers' shop for some pre-cooler penny sweets.
@OwsWills Thanks for the tongue, mate.
@AllthingsIC Thanks Rach!
How has it taken me this long to realise I was born on the same day as this guy? 🎂 https://t.co/NctTntquc0
Watching a cat watching a cat 😸 https://t.co/AunwEZkvYN
Common People on the victory bus back from Bristol 💸🍳🎸 #ccfc
@TomW1979 Shame you didn't make it down this weekend. En route back from Brizzle and about to meet @c_kirwan 🍻
@TomW1979 That's good to hear. Hopefully Warnock will stick him on the bench when we're safe and give him a whirl.
I've not been here for years so thanks to the @guardian for making me reassess my Cardiff breakfast goals 🍳 https://t.co/2fyyoebB7q
@jaybothroyd That katsu curry is almost as good as an away win! Hope you're good, champ. One of the greatest Bluebirds. 😎
The last time I was up this early to go to Bristol City away the game was called off but we did later see @jaybothroyd in Yo Sushi #ccfc
@lingdilong @TaikaWaititi @NZFilmCommissh I've already got a cat called Yoko (admittedly less gangsta). I sense a supergroup forming.
@lingdilong @TaikaWaititi @NZFilmCommissh Such a heartwarming film. Also wish I had a dog called Tupac.
@FootballRamble Rich Warnock imagery this week. My fave Colin story since my mate told me her mum sold him Percy, a Griffon Bruxellois.
So after their George Michael hypocrisy, now The Sun gets to write a Graham Taylor obituary...
@douglasfriedli If Jean-Claude Van Damme taught us anything, it was 'No Retreat, No Surrender'. Wise Belgian.
The real big question of Trump's impending presidency is what the hell is April Fools' Day going to have to pull to remain relevant?
@Sally_Dunbar Hey Sally, of course. What's your email address?
@CardiffCityFC Thanks for the memories, Whitts. Wild celebrations following his goal at Leicester in the 2010 play-… https://t.co/e7Ke1fqgGK
@BarcaBrin @olegunnar16 You need to read something by Enid Blyton now to level yourself out.
@Pret I knew you were arty, Pret. We could exhibit on the walls, above the sandwiches. People need culture with their coffee. Agreed?
@PodcastPeldroed You might be onto something. I don't think they'd need a bricklayer in Curacao.
@PodcastPeldroed My dad was there last week. I could have sent him on a recce.
Man, 40, hoodie (surf, not ASBO) just offered free flat white. 'I'll pay for it?' (OMG). 'You sure?' (Stay cool). 'Thanks, bro' (Killed it).
My next art project is based on a collage of facial reactions as people try their best to get a free soya latte at the Pret counter.
